Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

The dharma-nature of eye contact is boundless, the dharma-nature of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact is boundless;
The dharma-nature of eye contact and the resultant feelings is boundless, and the dharma-nature of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact and the resultant feelings is boundless;
The dharma-nature of the earth element is boundless, and the dharma-nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is boundless;
The dharma-nature of causal conditions is boundless, and the dharma-nature of immediate conditions, objective conditions, and dominant conditions is boundless;

The dharma-nature of ignorance is boundless, and the dharma-nature of karmic formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is boundless.

Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!ğŸ”½The dharma-nature of the emptiness of the form aggregate is boundless, and the dharma-nature of the emptiness of the feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness aggregates is boundless;
The dharma-nature of the emptiness of the eye sense base is boundless, and the dharma-nature of the emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases is boundless;
The emptiness of the dharma-nature of the form realm is boundless, and the emptiness of the dharma-nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is boundless;

The emptiness of the dharma-nature of eye contact is boundless, and the emptiness of the dharma-nature of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact is boundless;

The emptiness of ignorance has no boundary, and the emptiness of volitional actions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress has no boundary.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
The mind of the form aggregate has no boundary, because the mind of the form aggregate arises from activity;
The mind of the feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness aggregates has no boundary, because the mind of the feeling aggregates, etc., arises from activity.
The mind of the eye sense base has no boundary, because the mind of the eye sense base arises from activity;
The mind of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases has no boundary, because the mind of the ear sense bases, etc., arises from activity.
The mind of the form realm is boundless, because the mind of the form realm arises from mental activities;
The minds of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms are boundless, because the minds of the sound realm and so forth arise from mental activities.
The mind of the eye realm is boundless, because the mind of the eye realm arises from mental activities;
The minds of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind realms are boundless, because the minds of the ear realm and so forth arise from mental activities.

The mind of the earth element has no bounds, because the mind's activities arise from the earth element.

The mind of ignorance has no bounds, because the mind's activities arise from ignorance.

The mind of the constituents of form, perception, conception, and consciousness is boundless, because the mind that engages in the constituents of form, perception, conception, and consciousness arises.

translated: If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are able to contemplate and understand the aggregates in this way, and accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they will be able to avoid thoughts of deception and flattery, they will be able to avoid thoughts of arrogance and pride, they will be able to avoid thoughts of self-praise, they will be able to avoid thoughts of disparaging others, they will be able to avoid thoughts of the notion of self, they will be able to avoid thoughts of fame and gain, they will be able to avoid thoughts of the five hindrances, they will be able to avoid thoughts of jealousy and stinginess. Because of this, they will also be able to perfect all the rare and true pure merits that are difficult to obtain, they will also be able to perfect the adornment and purification of the Buddha lands, they will also be able to perfect the unsurpassed Buddha Dharma, namely the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

When the divine movement arrived, it quickly harmonized with the gathering of auspicious signs. On the summit of Vulture Peak, the extraordinary sound moved again.

It is precisely because the mind's path is easily overgrown and the emotions' mist is difficult to brush away, one is stuck in the cognition of form and obstructed in the emptiness of form and emptiness. How could one know that the essence of dharmas and the suchness of dharmas are neither one nor two, that nature and characteristics are only quiescent and cannot be sought with words or thoughts?

Since there is nothing present that can be unfolded, and nothing absent that can be rolled up, it is certainly not something that can be guided by mere traces, nor is it something that can be followed by dust-like footsteps. This is the practice that is not practiced!
It is the abiding that does not abide!

Contemplating the nature of non-duality with duality and non-duality, the name of non-one is in the constant one. Therefore, when agitated, it is myriad deviations; when still, it is the one suchness.

The one suchness is not limited, yet it is divided into meanings. The one meaning is not easy, yet the names differ. The one name is not changed, yet the thoughts trade it. The one thought is not branched, yet the views are confused.
Beyond this, it is boundless.

Therefore, if one forgets the right vehicle and the great mind, as well as the aspiration and rejoicing, then the aggregates of morality, concentration, and wisdom are present. If one clings to them, then there are inverted views of conceptual mind.

Those who see birth and death are in the three realms of existence, and those who cling to nirvana are the two vehicles. Therefore, knowing that birth and death are empty, one leaves the three realms!
Knowing that nirvana is empty, one transcends the two stages!
The Buddha's prediction of the five flowers is the proof of enlightenment, and the comparison of the seven treasures is the profound merit and virtue.
The heavenly offerings and heavenly protection, with the addition of praise, are sincere;
The divine spells and divine jewels, speaking of auspicious signs, are not ultimate.
